radiographic_examinations.findings: An enhancing mass, 2 cm in diameter, centered at the right orbital apex that extended into the right sphenoid and posterior ethmoid sinuses. The mass was isointense in relation to brain tissue but with hyperintense components and engulfed the right optic nerve.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: CT scan of the temporal bones
radiographic_examinations.findings: A destructive lesion in the region of the right supralateral sphenoid bone that extended into the anterior clinoid process and involved the optic canal. Elevated area of calcification suggested periosteal reaction.

An enhancing soft-tissue mass, 1.8 by 2.0 cm, centered in the right orbital apex with abnormal enhancement of soft tissue in the posterior right ethmoid and right sphenoid sinuses, contiguous with the mass and extending into the right cavernous sinus.
